details.excerpt: Here you’ll find details of related events and public meetings which the DaPaaS project partners will be supporting and participating at.
details.content:
Here you’ll find details of related events and public meetings which the DaPaaS project partners will be supporting and participating at.

European Data Forum 2014
Athens, Greece [March 19-20, 2014]

The EDF is the annual meeting-point for data practitioners from industry, research, policy makers, the wider public-sector and community initiatives, to discuss the opportunities and challenges of the emerging Data Economy in Europe.
Participating within EDF 2014 will be global experts in a wide range of fields, including: research, semantic technology, open and linked data, mobile application development and technical communications. By bringing together all stakeholders and practitioners involved in the data industry, this will allow for the fostering of ideas, new innovations and problem-solving associated challenges, leading to a strengthened data economy within Europe and increasing its visibility worldwide.

FutureEverything Festival 2014
Manchester, UK [March 27 - April 1, 2014]

FutureEverything brings together international delegates from design, urbanism art, business and academia to discover, share and experience new ideas about the future. Pioneering the idea of a ‘festival as laboratory’, it combines innovative art and performance with new technology, insightful discussion and playful social experimentation. The 2014 theme is ‘Tools for Unknown Futures’,and will explore how we can collaborate on new tools, devices and systems to transform many spheres of life, from the arts to democracy.

OKFestival
Berlin, Germany [July 15-18, 2014]

The Open Knowledge Festival is a global, inclusive and participatory event. It is organised by the Open Knowledge Foundation Central and owned by the open knowledge community in the broadest sense. The 2014 festival will focus on the themes of open data and open knowledge.
